text: John Waters (born April 22, 1946 in Baltimore, Maryland) is an American writer, stand up comedian and movie maker. He first became famous during the 1970s. He is the director of many movies. These include Hairspray (1988) and Serial Mom. Waters has written books. In 1986 Crackpot: The Obsessions of John Waters was published. Waters has acted in several movies. He did the voice of a gay man called "John" in an episode of The Simpsons called "Homer's Phobia". Waters is openly gay.Waters confesses ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Baltimore Category:American cinematographers Category:American movie actors Category:American movie editors Category:American stand-up comedians Category:American television actors Category:American television writers Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from Baltimore Category:Gay men Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT comedians Category:LGBT directors Category:LGBT producers Category:American LGBT writers Category:Movie directors from Maryland Category:Movie producers from Maryland Category:Screenwriters from Maryland Category:Writers from Baltimore
title: John Waters
